page.title: 10LOCAL EVENTS
page.content: ANNUAL EVENTS STILL REFLECT THE RURAL NATURE OF THE AREA. THE CHURCH FETE, AND A SIMILAR EVENT TO RAISE FUNDS FOR THE UPKEEP OF THE RECREATION GROUND, ATTRACT ABOUT 500 PEOPLE EACH. FORMER RESIDENTS OFTEN RETURN TO MEET FRIENDS AND CONTRIBUTE FINANCIALLY WHEN THE VICAR OPENS HIS GARDENS FOR A CHURCH "DO". NEWER RESIDENTS TEND TO INVOLVE THEMSELVES WITH THE "REC" EVENT. THE MAIN INDOOR SOCIAL EVENTS ARE DANCES. OFTEN RUN BY THE PARENTS OF SCHOOL CHILDREN. THE FIRST SCHOOL HAD A TULIP DANCE WITH A TRIP TO HOLLAND AS A PRIZE, THE LOCAL DRAMA GROUP HAVE ALSO ENTERTAINED. MANY MONTHLY AND WEEKLY EVENTS TAKE PLACE. IN THESE SEXES AND AGES TEND TO BE SEGREGATED, BROWNIES AND CUBS ARE A TYPICAL EXAMPLE, AND SO IS THE LOCAL BRANCH OF THE WOMENS INSTITUTE.
